Event.name: Deny_or_grant_permission
Event.definition:
<def-root>In this frame, an <fen>Authority</fen> allows a <fen>Protagonist</fen> to know (in some way) that they may or may not engage in an <fen>Action</fen>. For lexical units of this frame marked with the semantic type "Negative", e.g., authorize.v, the <fen>Authority</fen> has the power to tell the <fen>Protagonist</fen> not to do something, but does not do so. It is assumed that if the <fen>Protagonist</fen> engages in the <fen>Action</fen> without permission, then the <fen>Authority</fen> will punish the <fen>Protagonist</fen> in some way, at least with disapproval; if the <fen>Authority</fen> grants permission, however, the <fen>Authority</fen> is agreeing not to impose a punishment on the <fen>Protagonist</fen> for performing the <fen>Action</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Authority">The police officer</fex> <t>forbid</t> <fex name="Protagonist">me</fex> <fex name="Action">from turning around</fex> .</ex> <ex> <fex name="Authority">My mother</fex> <t>okayed</t> <fex name="Protagonist">me</fex> <fex name="Action">to go to the movies with Simon</fex> . </ex>
<ex> <fex name="Authority">The teacher</fex> <m>gave</m> <fex name="Protagonist">the children</fex> <t>permission</t> <fex name="Action">to eat their lunch outside</fex>. </ex>
<ex><fex name="Authority">The Church</fex> had <t>sanctioned</t> <fex name="Circumstances">for recital after Mass</fex> <fex name="Action">a special prayer to St. Michael</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Authority
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Authority</fen> orders the <fen>Protagonist</fen> to not engage in a particular <fen>Action</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Protagonist
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Protagonist</fen> wants to engage in an <fen>Action</fen>, but is ordered not to by the <fen>Authority</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Action
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Action</fen> is what the <fen>Protagonist</fen> seeks to do, but is ordered not to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> is when the denying of permission occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Place</fen> is where the denial of permission occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Purpose</fen> is what the <fen>Authority</fen> hopes to accomplish by denying permission.</def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition:
<def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.
First, it applies to appraisals of the event, typically a judgment of its expectedness. The notion of appraisal requires a factive portrayal of the event. The second subgroup consists of any descriptions of the state of affairs denoted by the target as role fillers in other frames. The state of affairs reported by the target is understood to play a role in the state of affairs of the modifier. What that role is depends only on the predicate heading the modifier phrase.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>This frame element selects some gradable attribute and modifies the expected value for it.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes a proposition from which the main clause (headed by the target) logically follows. </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Allowed_category
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A category that the <fen>Action</fen> fits into, which dictates the <fen>Action</fen>'s being permitted (in accord with some implicit Principle.)
<ex>The transfer was <t>sanctioned</t> <fex name="Allowed_category">as a "necessary precaution"</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Period_of_iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The length of time from when the event denoted by the target began to be repeated to when it stopped.</def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A description of the <fen>Authority</fen> or the <fen>Protagonist</fen> while they are involved in the action.
<ex>He granted <t>permission</t> <fex name="Depictive">fully aware of her crime</fex> .</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>A holistic description of the event (the same way), or a description of the <fen>Authority</fen> that also affects the overall event (carefully).</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>The action performed by an <fen>Authority</fen> that brings about the Denying or Granting Permission.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: outlaw.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make illegal to do something.

lexUnit.name: disallow.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to refuse to allow; reject

lexUnit.name: approval.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the action of approving of something.

lexUnit.name: authorize.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: grant clearance for something to occur

lexUnit.name: clear.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to allow by deeming fit

lexUnit.name: greenlight.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give permission to go ahead with.

lexUnit.name: mandate.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: authorization to carry out a policy, usually granted by an organization or by the electorate in an election, e.g. a U.N. mandate, re-election with a mandate to improve public schools.

lexUnit.name: permit.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: give permission to (someone) or for (something).

lexUnit.name: restrict.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: deprive of freedom of movement or action.

lexUnit.name: prohibition.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: statement or situation that indicates that (someone) does not allow (something).
